org.da.expressionj.util
Class ExpressionCombiner

java.lang.Object
  org.da.expressionj.util.ExpressionCombiner

public class ExpressionCombiner
extends java.lang.Object

This class allows to combine two expressions. This class provide several method:

  • replace(Expression, java.lang.String, Expression): Change a value in an Expression. The change consist in replacing a Variable by an Expression, which may contain Variables.
  • add(Expression, Expression): Add two expressions.
  • subtract(Expression, Expression): Substract two expressions.
  • multiply(Expression, Expression): Multiply two expressions.
  • divide(Expression, Expression): Divide two expressions.
More simple methods also exist to easily add, subtract, multiply, or divide an expression with an int or a float.

Constructor Detail

ExpressionCombiner

public ExpressionCombiner()
Method Detail

setCopyBehavior

public void setCopyBehavior(int copyBehavior)
Set the copy behavior of this ExpressionCombiner.
  • DONT_COPY: return the expression (no copy)
  • SHALLOW_COPY: return a shallow copy of the expression
  • DEEP_COPY: return a deep copy of the expression

getCopyBehavior

public int getCopyBehavior()
Get the copy behavior of this ExpressionCombiner.

replace

public Expression replace(Expression expr,
                          java.lang.String varName,
                          Expression replacedExpr)
Replace a variable in an expression by another sub-expression. For example, if we have:
then the result is sin((b * c) + 2)

Note that:

  • The method will return the first expression if the sub-expression is equal to the first
  • The method will also return the first expression if the variable is not present in the first expression

Parameters:
expr - the expression
varName - the name of the variable which must be replaced
replacedExpr - the expression which must replace the variable
